title: Nethermind crashes with no error after eating all the RAM
body:
**Describe the bug**
This happened fourth time for the last 2 days during SnapSync (SNAP - progress of State Ranges (Phase 1)).
Application works just fine and utilizing about 6 to 8 gigs of RAM but at some point it starts to output
tremendous amount of logs like:
`2022-09-07 02:12:06.8669|A new block 15438574 (0x85828f...9ad28b) in fast sync transition branch - state not found`
and RAM utilization goes to 100% and it crashes with no error. Last logs before restart:
```2022-09-07 02:12:07.1784|A new block 15438572 (0xa61462...ed613c) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:07.4261|A new block 15438571 (0xea034a...62b7a1) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:07.6157|A new block 15438570 (0xd31300...cca5e3) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:07.7118|A new block 15438569 (0xc85ddd...1298b5) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:07.9265|A new block 15438568 (0x7d4fd2...29c393) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:08.0205|A new block 15438567 (0x96fa7e...69abf9) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:08.0802|Downloaded 15487619 / 15487651 | current     0.00bps | total     0.07bps
2022-09-07 02:12:08.2126|A new block 15438566 (0xe9bc51...b16d06) in fast sync transition branch - state not found
2022-09-07 02:12:12.8184|Downloaded 15487619 / 15487651 | current     0.00bps | total     0.07bps
2022-09-07 02:12:15.6636|Downloaded 15487619 / 15487651 | current     0.00bps | total     0.07bps
2022-09-07 02-12-20.9144|Nethermind starting initialization.
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1753|Loading embedded plugins
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1755|  Found plugin type Nethermind.Consensus.AuRa.AuRaPlugin
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1755|  Found plugin type Nethermind.Consensus.Clique.CliquePlugin
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1755|  Found plugin type Nethermind.Consensus.Ethash.EthashPlugin
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1755|  Found plugin type Nethermind.Consensus.Ethash.NethDevPlugin
2022-09-07 02-12-21.1755|  Found plugin type Nethermind.Hive.HivePlugin```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run docker with command:
```sudo docker run -t -d -v $HOME/nethermind:/var/lib/nethermind \
-v $HOME/jwtsecret:/var/lib/jwtsecret \
--network host \
--name nethermind nethermind/nethermind:latest \
--config mainnet \
--datadir /var/lib/nethermind \
--Sync.SnapSync true \
--Sync.AncientBodiesBarrier 11052984 \
--Sync.AncientReceiptsBarrier 11052984 \
--JsonRpc.Enabled true \
--JsonRpc.EngineHost 0.0.0.0 \
--JsonRpc.EnginePort 8551 \
--JsonRpc.JwtSecretFile /var/lib/jwtsecret/jwt.hex \
--JsonRpc.AdditionalRpcUrls "http://localhost:8551|http;ws|net;eth;subscribe;engine;web3;client" \
--Pruning.Mode=Full \
--Merge.Enabled true```

2. Run Prysm Beacon Node and Validator on the same machine:
```sudo docker run -t -d -v $HOME/.eth2:/data \
-v $HOME/jwtsecret:/var/lib/jwtsecret \
--network host \
--name beacon-node gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable \
--mainnet \
--datadir=/data \
--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
--p2p-host-ip={VM_IP} \
--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 \
--execution-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8551 \
--jwt-secret=/var/lib/jwtsecret/jwt.hex \
--suggested-fee-recipient=0xEad087dfBcAd3B48c9B05A9a4e3ff79C88d97340 \
--checkpoint-sync-url={INFURA_URL} \
--genesis-beacon-api-url={INFURA_URL} \
--accept-terms-of-use```

3. Wait around 8 hours
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
RAM utilization should stay around 6 - 8 gigs, SnapSync should continue processing, no restart should happen without an error.

**Screenshots**
Metrics from VM (Network IO/RAM/CPU utilization)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13677730/188796980-3fa5540d-d54c-4ccb-a6f4-ee2aa3b61b32.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04.5 LTS or Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS (happened on both)
 - Docker version 20.10.12, build 20.10.12-0ubuntu2~20.04.1
 - Nethermind Image sha256:c35fdbca41ed16d4ff22ed24c668be401e6a58c07f2cdf5402d3d320a1439fbc

**Additional context**
Running in Azure VM (Standard D4as v4 (4 vcpus, 16 GiB memory)), 2048 GiB Premium SSD as OS Disk

@LukaszRozmej @matilote @MarekM25 sorry for this rude chime-in, but I would like to hear some workaround/config changes to have this SnapSync is done, since it restarts every 8-12 hours and sync starts over, so I feel like I`m in a dead loop here, thank you!

> @LukaszRozmej @matilote @MarekM25 sorry for this rude chime-in, but I would like to hear some workaround/config changes to have this SnapSync is done, since it restarts every 8-12 hours and sync starts over, so I feel like I`m in a dead loop here, thank you!

Thanks for reporting. It will help us resolve the problem!. It seems that it is connected to this issue: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/4526
It looks like we have edge case during the sync. If I were you, I would try resync from scratch. Snap Sync is fast, so it shouldn't take long time. Our team will try to resolve root cause in the same time.
@MarekM25 btw, I tried to make a memory dump and it says Process xxx not running compatible .NET runtime. I was installing .net 6, is this the correct one?

> @MarekM25 thanks for the quick reply, when you say
> 
> > I would try resync from scratch
> 
> How can I do that? could you please point me to doc where I can prune existing state and start from scratch, thanks!

Just close your client and remove your database folder. You can find the default db path here: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Runner/configs/mainnet.cfg#L5
@MarekM25, currently Nethermind is in a almost died state, when it eaten all the memory but still working, do you want me to do something for you in that state?

> @MarekM25, currently Nethermind is in a almost died state, when it eaten all the memory but still working, do you want me to do something for you in that state?

Thx a lot. It is not needed :) Your bug report helped me understand more about the root cause. I think we can explore this issue without your DB! :) Let me know if the fresh sync will work for you.
ah ok, glad to hear that, good luck then 😉

@MarekM25  little update after 3 hours of sync I noticed such messages:

than this message 
`2022-09-07 10:26:55.8548|Sync mode changed from FastSync, SnapSync to Disconnected`

after 5 minutes it recovered sync

```
2022-09-07 10:30:01.9031|Changing state FastSync, SnapSync to SnapSync at processed:0|state:0|block:15489332|header:15489749|chain difficulty:58160603428264791926830|peer block:15489781|peer total difficulty:58166056879121714677940
